chef_bio: Zakir Ahmed is a British chef, restaurateur, television personality, and writer. He has been awarded a total of 16 Michelin stars, and his restaurants have been awarded a combined total of 7 Michelin stars. Smith is known for his fiery temper and high standards in the kitchen, and he has become a popular figure in reality television cooking shows.

recipes.name: Beef Wellington
recipes.description: A classic British dish consisting of beef fillet coated with pâté and duxelles, then wrapped in puff pastry and baked.
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Season the beef filet with salt and pepper.
Heat a large skillet over high heat and add a little olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the beef filet and sear it on all sides until browned. Remove from the pan and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the mushrooms, garlic, thyme, and butter. Cook until the mushrooms are soft and the liquid has evaporated.
Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch. Spread the Dijon mustard over the pastry.
Place the mushroom mixture in the center of the pastry, forming a rectangle about the same length and width as the beef filet.
Place the beef filet on top of the mushroom mixture and fold the pastry up and over the beef, pressing the edges together to seal.
Brush the pastry with the beaten egg yolk and use a sharp knife to score the pastry in a decorative pattern.
Place the Beef Wellington on a baking sheet and bake for about 30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the beef is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
Let the Beef Wellington rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Scrambled Eggs
cooking_method: Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them until the yolks and whites are well combined.
Add the milk, salt, and pepper to the eggs and whisk everything together until well combined.
Melt the butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Once melted, swirl the pan to coat the bottom evenly with the melted butter.
Add the egg mixture to the skillet and let it cook for a few seconds, until the eggs begin to set around the edges.
Use a spatula to gently stir the eggs from the outside in, scraping the bottom of the skillet as you go. Keep stirring and scraping until the eggs are cooked through and no longer runny.
Remove the skillet from the heat and transfer the scrambled eggs to a serving plate. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Fish and Chips
recipes.description: Crispy battered fish served with thick-cut chips, a classic British dish that's always popular.
cooking_method: Preheat the oven according to the instructions on the French fries bag.
Arrange the frozen fish fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Sprinkle the fish fillets with salt to taste.
Bake the fish fillets in the oven for the amount of time specified on the packaging.
While the fish is baking, prepare the French fries according to the instructions on the bag. Usually this involves spreading them out on a baking sheet and baking them in the oven alongside the fish.
When both the fish and fries are done, remove them from the oven and transfer them to a serving plate.
Serve the fish and chips immediately, with any desired condiments such as ketchup or tartar sauce.

chef_bio: Soumita Osman is a British chef and restaurateur who is known for his approachable style of cooking and his commitment to healthy eating. He has published numerous cookbooks, hosted several cooking shows, and opened several restaurants around the world. Osman is also an advocate for food education and has launched several initiatives to improve food quality in schools.

recipes.name: Roast Chicken
recipes.description: Juicy and succulent roast chicken, infused with herbs and lemon.
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels. Place the chicken in a roasting pan, breast side up.
Melt the butter in a small bowl and brush it over the chicken, making sure to coat it evenly.
Mix together the salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder in a small bowl, and sprinkle the seasoning mixture over the chicken.
Roast the chicken in the oven for about 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F when measured with a meat thermometer.
Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 10-15 minutes before carving.
Serve the roast chicken with your favorite sides and enjoy!
